description: The construction blueprints for Pluton, one of the three Ancient Weapons. These blueprints contain the knowledge to build a warship capable of mass destruction. Iceburg possesses the real blueprints, which have been passed down through generations of Water 7 shipwrights.

keyMoments.title: Iceburg Reveals He Has Pluton Blueprints
keyMoments.description: Iceburg reveals to Robin that he possesses the blueprints for the ancient weapon Pluton, explaining why CP9 has targeted him.
keyMoments.significance: Major world-building reveal that introduces Pluton as a key element and explains the true motivation behind the Water 7 conflict.

keyMoments.title: Paulie Reveals Fake Blueprints
keyMoments.description: Paulie reveals that the blueprints he was carrying are fakes, not the real Pluton blueprints, showing that Iceburg had prepared for the CP9 attack.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the precautions taken to protect the real blueprints.

powers: Contains knowledge to construct the ancient warship Pluton
Represents one of the three Ancient Weapons' construction methods
significance: The Pluton blueprints are one of the most sought-after items by the World Government. They represent the potential to create a weapon of mass destruction and are central to the Water 7/Enies Lobby saga. The blueprints have been protected by Water 7 shipwrights for generations.

name.japanese: 偽のプルトンの設計図

description: Counterfeit blueprints created as decoys to protect the real Pluton blueprints. These fake blueprints were carried by Paulie as part of Iceburg's trap to identify and expose the CP9 agents.

keyMoments.title: Paulie Reveals Fake Blueprints
keyMoments.description: Paulie drops the fake blueprints and reveals to the shocked CP9 agent that they are not the real Pluton blueprints.
keyMoments.significance: Shows that Iceburg and his allies were prepared for the CP9 attack with contingency plans.

ownershipHistory.methodObtained: Given by Iceburg as part of the trap
ownershipHistory.methodLost: Dropped when wounded, taken by CP9 agent

significance: The fake blueprints serve as a plot device to show Iceburg's strategic thinking and his awareness that he was being targeted. They also demonstrate the lengths to which the Water 7 shipwrights will go to protect the real Pluton blueprints.
